coredata.dc:title: Improving dimensionality reduction with spectral gradient descent

coredata.dc:description:
Abstract
               
                  We introduce spectral gradient descent, a way of improving iterative dimensionality reduction techniques.
                        1
                     
                     
                        1
                        An abbreviated version of some portions of this article appeared in Memisevic and Hinton (2005a), published under the IEEE copyright.
                      The method uses information contained in the leading eigenvalues of a data affinity matrix to modify the steps taken during a gradient-based optimization procedure. We show that the approach is able to speed up the optimization and to help dimensionality reduction methods find better local minima of their objective functions. We also provide an interpretation of our approach in terms of the power method for finding the leading eigenvalues of a symmetric matrix and verify the usefulness of the approach in some simple experiments.
